p: When choice enabled and disabled individuals make the same number of yearly contacts, HIV prevalence in women (men) is estimated at 34.0% (19.3%) with no intervention. When an intervention targeting HIV-negative individuals is implemented, this estimate drops to 19.3% (11.9%) with an intervention where individuals remain choice disabled for 1 year on average. When both HIV positive and HIV negative individuals are included in the intervention, the estimated HIV prevalence is reduced further to 15.0% (9.6%)
